artists.name: Claude Monet
artists.bio: Claude Monet was a French painter, a founder of French Impressionist painting and the most consistent and prolific practitioner of the movement's philosophy of expressing one's perceptions before nature.

artworks.title: Water Lilies
artworks.description: A series of approximately 250 oil paintings depicting Monet's flower garden at Giverny.

artists.name: Pierre-Auguste Renoir
artists.bio: Renoir was a leading painter in the development of the Impressionist style, celebrated for his vibrant light and saturated color.

artworks.title: Dance at Le Moulin de la Galette
artworks.description: One of Impressionism's most celebrated masterpieces, depicting a lively outdoor scene in Montmartre.

artists.name: Édouard Manet
artists.bio: Édouard Manet was a pivotal figure in the transition from Realism to Impressionism.

artworks.title: Olympia
artworks.description: One of Manet's most famous paintings, causing controversy when first exhibited in 1865.

artists.name: Edgar Degas
artists.bio: Degas is famous for his paintings, sculptures, prints, and drawings. He is especially identified with the subject of dance.

artworks.title: The Ballet Class
artworks.description: Depicting ballerinas in rehearsal, it's one of Degas's most iconic works.

artists.name: Camille Pissarro
artists.bio: Pissarro was a Danish-French Impressionist and Neo-Impressionist painter born on the island of St Thomas.

artworks.title: The Boulevard Montmartre at Night
artworks.description: One of Pissarro's masterpieces, showcasing his innovative approach to urban scenes.

artists.name: Mary Cassatt
artists.bio: Cassatt was an American painter and printmaker who was an active member of the Impressionists in Paris.

artworks.title: The Child's Bath
artworks.description: One of Cassatt's most famous works, focusing on the theme of the intimate bonds between mothers and children.

artists.name: Alfred Sisley
artists.bio: Sisley was an Impressionist landscape painter who was born and spent most of his life in France, but retained British citizenship.

artworks.title: The Bridge at Villeneuve-la-Garenne
artworks.description: A beautiful portrayal of the Seine river, showcasing Sisley's masterful use of light and color.

artists.name: Berthe Morisot
artists.bio: Morisot was a member of the circle of painters in Paris who became known as the Impressionists.

artworks.title: The Cradle
artworks.description: An intimate depiction of maternal love, reflecting Morisot's delicate touch.

artists.name: Gustave Caillebotte
artists.bio: Caillebotte was a French painter, member and patron of the artists known as Impressionists.

artworks.title: Paris Street; Rainy Day
artworks.description: A masterpiece of urban Impressionism, capturing the essence of a rainy day in Paris.

artists.name: Paul Cézanne
artists.bio: Cézanne was a French artist and Post-Impressionist painter whose work laid the foundations of the transition from 19th-century Impressionism to a new and radically different world of art in the 20th century.

artworks.title: The Card Players
artworks.description: One of Cézanne's most famous series, depicting Provençal peasants immersed in card games.
